metadata.synopsis: If the player has rescued Omeluum from the Iron Throne, then he is in the Lodge for the Society of Brilliance. He tells the player about the events that led him to be imprisoned on the throne, reflects on the outcomes of the rescue (whether the other hostages/Duke Ravengard were saved), and provides them with a reward for his rescue.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Debugbook option Act3 → LOW - Lodge → Omeluum escaped

6.speaker: Omeluum
6.text: Such violence has no place here. The Society is an institution that aims to bring about peace. Not destruction.

13.speaker: Omeluum
13.text: Blurg... my loyal friend. I will not find the likes of his mind and curiosity again.

57.speaker: Omeluum
57.text: This city is no place for the peaceful pursuit of knowledge. I am... disappointed.

59.speaker: Omeluum
59.text: I take it you came here to seek a reward for my rescue?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Now that you mention it, saving you was a lot of effort...

2.speaker: Omeluum
2.text: Based on my observations, I have selected certain items I believe will be useful in fighting your cause.

30.speaker: Omeluum
30.text: I hope they help you to avoid the fate shared by my colleagues.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum hands reward to player (unseen)

54.speaker: Omeluum
54.text: Search at your leisure. I must prepare for my return to the Underdark.

93.speaker: Omeluum
93.text: At least there my research may yet do some good, even without the support of the Society.

9.speaker: Omeluum
9.text: It is what Blurg would have wanted.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I killed your colleagues. I just came to finish the job.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: MindmeldNodeContext: Angered, about to attack

8.speaker: Omeluum
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: MindmeldNodeContext: Angered, about to attack

23.speaker: Player
23.text: No need. You've lost too much here already.

39.speaker: Omeluum
39.text: I must agree. I feel a surprising heaviness within me. But it will pass, I am sure.

11.speaker: Omeluum
11.text: I will return to the Underdark alone. My research there may yet help its inhabitants, even without the Society's help.

52.speaker: Omeluum
52.text: It is... pleasurable to see you. Your intervention within the cult's underwater complex was a timely one.

61.speaker: Omeluum
61.text: I am glad my carelessness did not cost the life of Duke Ravengard.

36.speaker: Omeluum
36.text: That you also saved me was unexpected.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Why were you down there in the first place?

5.speaker: Omeluum
5.text: My meeting with you led me to a most unsettling conclusion. That my kind had begun to exert influence through this 'Cult of the Absolute.'

50.speaker: Omeluum
50.text: I felt illithid interference would not be conducive to this plane's survival. I sought out other infected individuals to ascertain the truth of my hypothesis.

1.speaker: Omeluum
1.text: Unfortunately, I strayed too close. I was captured and transported to the prison in which you found me.

96.speaker: Omeluum
96.text: There I saw Gortash and his followers inflict cruelties far beyond any I witnessed in the Underdark.

76.speaker: Omeluum
76.text: I am grateful that you were spared such a merciless fate.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: You tried to save me once. Only fair that I repay the favour.

46.speaker: Omeluum
46.text: Then you would keep our equation balanced. A logical approach.

68.speaker: Omeluum
68.text: The aid you rendered to me far outweighs that which I provided in the Underdark.

65.speaker: Omeluum
65.text: The ring I gave possessed no real capacity to control the tadpole's influence. I simply wished to give you hope.

37.speaker: Omeluum
37.text: Because hope is important to your kind. Given enough of it, I believed you would not give up on finding the explanation for your tadpole's stasis.

58.speaker: Omeluum
58.text: Now I am able to provide more tangible means of assisting in your continued survival.

81.speaker: Omeluum
81.text: Blurg and I have consulted on the matter of your reward.

102.speaker: Omeluum
102.text: We first thought to ask the denizens of the Underdark for their aid in fighting the cult. Alas, our influence there remains negligible.

89.speaker: Omeluum
89.text: Instead, we have selected a series of items from the Society's vaults.

100.speaker: Omeluum
100.text: Given my kind's involvement in creating this evil, it is only right that I do my part in helping you defeat it. Or at least, improving your odds.
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum hands reward to player (unseen)

91.speaker: Omeluum
91.text: Curious. I appear to have left them elsewhere in the Lodge.
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld. Omeluum gestures as though about to take out an item. He doesn't find it.

32.speaker: Omeluum
32.text: You found me at the bottom of the harbour. No doubt you will track them down with ease.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Don't worry. I realised for myself some time ago.

49.speaker: Omeluum
49.text: As was to be expected. It was only a temporary measure, but one I believed might give you time to find a genuine explanation for your tadpole's stasis.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: So I've been wearing that ring for nothing?

66.speaker: Omeluum
66.text: You wore it because you believed it helped. Therefore it was helping you. Your belief was the ring's purpose, and it served it well.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: You tricked me. I cannot abide trickery.

78.speaker: Omeluum
78.text: The ring possessed no ability to interfere with your tadpole's stasis. You were in no more danger than before. However, I understand you are disappointed.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: That's legitimate - my master used similar conceptual tools to focus my mind during training.

43.speaker: Omeluum
43.text: Indeed. It is sometimes necessary to divert the unformed mind from distractions that lead thinking away from the path of truth.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I would never have left you behind. I rather like you.

103.speaker: Omeluum
103.text: I too feel some... warmth at your presence.

18.speaker: Omeluum
18.text: Your inclination to generosity is an admirable quality. One I wish to reciprocate.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Gratitude won't keep a roof over my head...

86.speaker: Omeluum
86.text: I understand my gratitude has limited use. You desire more practical compensation for your troubles.

75.speaker: Omeluum
75.text: Once my report is completed, I will return to my usual work in the Underdark. There, at least, I may yet produce worthwhile results.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Hard for you to reward me from the bottom of the ocean.

99.speaker: Omeluum
99.text: A valid hypothesis. One I am glad we do not need to prove.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'd no idea your expectations of me were so low.

105.speaker: Omeluum
105.text: It was not a judgement on your abilities. It was simply the result of my calculations, given the likely outcomes of such a rescue attempt.

55.speaker: Omeluum
55.text: I believed my life to be of the least value in the equation. But I am grateful to have it, as is the Society.

72.speaker: Omeluum
72.text: Welcome to the Society of Brilliance.

4.speaker: Omeluum
4.text: My colleagues here are grateful you came to my rescue. Though I regret that my investigations ended in such failure.

14.speaker: Omeluum
14.text: I did not expect that mine would be the life you chose to save.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Why were you down there in the first place?

35.speaker: Omeluum
35.text: I knew my imprisonment was of my own making. I therefore believed it best for you to save those who invited no such consequence.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: A generous attitude. Most would only think to save themselves.

48.speaker: Omeluum
48.text: I do not share my kind's opinions on the value of other living beings. I would have seen them all saved, if I could.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I tried to save everyone. It just wasn't possible.

22.speaker: Omeluum
22.text: Indeed. Once a reaction has been set in motion, it is difficult to prevent its completion.

95.speaker: Omeluum
95.text: He meant something to this city. Yet it was I you rescued.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: The hostages meant nothing to me.

53.speaker: Omeluum
53.text: They were innocents, whereas I brought my fate upon myself.

25.speaker: Omeluum
25.text: Do not think me ungrateful. I am pleased at my continued existence.

31.speaker: Omeluum
31.text: Still, I feel a heaviness within me. Ravengard's death will destabilise Baldur's Gate. It may adapt, or it may perish. But it will undoubtedly be transformed.

12.speaker: Omeluum
12.text: Blurgh and I have consulted on the matter of your reward. Your efforts require some recognition.

44.speaker: Omeluum
44.text: Still, I feel a heaviness within me, that my life alone should be worth the loss of so many others. Such extinctions are... regrettable.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I didn't care who 'deserved' to be saved. You have the most to offer me.

42.speaker: Omeluum
42.text: Ah. Then you did not act so impulsively as I. And your assumption was not an unfounded one.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: The Society has deep pockets. I expect to get paid for it.

73.speaker: Omeluum
73.text: It is... pleasurable to see you. Your intervention within the cult's underwater complex was a timely one.

79.speaker: Omeluum
79.text: I am glad my carelessness did not cost the lives of the innocents captives.

97.speaker: Omeluum
97.text: Such violence has no place here. The Society is an institution that aims to bring about peace. Not destruction.

104.speaker: Omeluum
104.text: It is best I do not interfere further with events on the surface. I will return to my research - it has been neglected long enough.
